channel.title: Bad Logging In
channel.description: Okay so I'm using a client with a 317 cache and I tried to add the 474 style theme (or kinda 474 added a bit of my style looks okay to me) anyways I changed my background and changed the Log in-box also so when I log in when I type in my password it doesn't show up equal to the line where it should be typed at if anyone could help me solve this problem it would be really appreciated thanks... :) oh and here's a picture of my problem....

item.title: Bad Logging In
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“r0m3r0, post:13, topic:421218”]Alright. Make the first

j += 15;

j += 20;
That SHOULD work. :p[/quote]

thanks so much it worked only i messed wit it til i got it to fit changed to 25 thanks soooo much would rep but sorry can’t but still thanks soooooo much
[/quote]
Np

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Logging In
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“r0m3r0, post:11, topic:421218”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=523883.msg3815476#msg3815476 date=1321304801]
Oh. Then change the

c / 2 - 88

to

c / 2 84

[/quote]

thanks for help actually helped a bit but it didn’t do what i wanted it to do all it did was change this

if it was like this: |
its now like this: |[/quote]
Alright. Make the first

j += 15;

j += 20;
That SHOULD work.

item.title: Bad Logging In
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“r0m3r0, post:7, topic:421218”]its delta… i think it has sumthin to do wit this bit of code… aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xffffff, "username" + aString1173 + ((anInt1216 == 0) & (anInt1161 % 40 < 20) ? "@yel@|" : ""), j); j += 15; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 88, 0xffffff, "password" + Class50.method588(aString1174, 0) + ((anInt1216 == 1) & (anInt1161 % 40 < 20) ? "@yel@|" : ""), j); j += 10;
make the last line

j += 15;

And if that doesn’t work, increase the 15.[/quote]

Read full topic

I know… I think… anyways i trying to change where the password thing is typed as in make the entering the password a little bit lower not sure where or how to do that… that’s why i posted it do you think you could help me change it…?

yeah just search where the code is from the inlogscreen,
If it’s a pi I think it’s rsinterface.java
When u found the code u have to change the coords of where the pass string is displayed
